messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] A few whines/wines about the conference
messages.msgSnippet: Jon and Rue Kream  wrote:
messages.messageBody:
Jon and Rue Kream" <skreams@...> wrote:

<<Hearing about everyone sitting around drinking wine last year made me so
jealous. I definitely want some hanging out time with you guys, and my big
fear about the conference is that I'm going to revert back to high school
shy when I see you all together, some of you already friends. So someone
take pity on me and pull me into the group if I'm standing there like a deer
in headlights, ok? ~Rue (lover of cheap champagne) >>


Rue - you just described me to a tee.
That was/is me too, shy and it's hard for me to walk up to a group and join
in.
Just a few months ago, a lady in our homeschool group said I reminded her of
a deer in headlights!
Please someone pull me into the group, too, because I want to be there but
it's hard sometimes. :o)

Karin in AZ - who likes wine/champagne well enough but can't drink too much
or it will put me to sleep!

** So, my tip is "if overwhelmed by fear, then hide in the bathroom and say

what to say! <g>

Kelli~ who will greet you all at the registration area

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] A few whines/wines about the conference
messages.msgSnippet: **Hearing about everyone sitting around drinking wine last year made me so jealous.  I definitely want some hanging out time with you guys, and my big fear
messages.messageBody:
**Hearing about everyone sitting around drinking wine last year made me so
jealous. I definitely want some hanging out time with you guys, and my big
fear about the conference is that I'm going to revert back to high school
shy when I see you all together, some of you already friends.**

The first time I went to a conference where I could meet online friends
I went back into the bathroom to comb my hair and wash my hands and get
up my nerve seven times. Well, maybe it was only four or five, but it
sure felt like seven.

So, my tip is "if overwhelmed by fear, then hide in the bathroom and say
"Hello" to everyone who joins you there, because they're probably shy, too".

Have a good time!

Betsy
